ygData.subject: Re: days played
ygData.msgSnippet: My top character is level 16 (well 15 now, but that is a long story.. he WAS 16) and made that in under 6 game days. A good deal of that was spent dying and
ygData.messageBody:
My top character is level 16 (well 15 now, but that is a long story..
he WAS 16) and made that in under 6 game days. A good deal of that was spent
dying and wandering. If I concentrate on him he should hit 20 in 10 game days
easily and I would hardly consider myself experienced. I would bet a twinked,
power leveled character can hit 20 in 5 days or less. I have a friend who hit
20 in 6 days with his Barbarian Warrior.

Richard

> From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>
> Talking about days played, this reminds me of the discussion we had
> on here a while back about twinking a character to level 20. Someone
> mentioned that it could be done in 10 game days. Others believed
> that that would be nearly impossible.
> I have a 12th level cleric (just made 12th last night) and I have
> been playing for 5 game days. Now I spend a great deal of time doing
> "crap" in terms of experience - raising skills, swimming, raising
> sense-heading, fishing, exploring, doing quests, etc. Basically just
> having fun with the game. I came across a Druid that was around 9th
> or 10th when I first grouped with her. I think at the time I was
> probably 10th level. I added her to my friends list. When I saw her
> again, she was 16th - I removed her from my friends list knowing I
> would probably never get to group with her again as she had outleveled
> me. Last time I saw her was week before last and she was 19th.
> So, I guess my point is, if you're very aggressive and fight a lot
> of monsters steadily, you can really level rapidly. This would
> obviously have to be someone that's a very experienced player cause
> it's hard to otherwise know where to go and what to do. Relative
> newcomers, like myself, are more intrigued just by exploring and
> doing quests than by just hardcore leveling.
>
>
>
> >From: "I. G" <shadowtg1@...>
> >
> >Azor, you have hit the nail on the head! Now I to admit I am hooked like a
> >Mo Fo., but I do have time limits on it (imposed by me!) As it is I have
> >lived many many days on that damn game... and I will most likly live many
> >more...
> >
> >Jaxim
> >
> >
> >>From: "Azor" <jmaynus@...>
> >>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> >>To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
> >>Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Team Server
> >>Date: Fri, 30 Jul 1999 22:45:15 -0400
> >>
> >>From: "Azor" <jmaynus@...>
> >>
> >>I can't believe how that Team Server went, even tho the had a banner up
> >>about all day saying "PLEASE don't hang out on the chat server waiting for
> >>Tallon Zek, it will be up much,, much later tonight" ppl still lived in
> >>the
> >>chat rooms making it VERY hard to log into the game. Heard there was over
> >>4,000 ppl in Tallon Zek when it went live, not too long after it went up
> >>they took it down saying they wasn't gonna put it back up till they had
> >>more
> >>Team Servers up and that would be at least a week.
> >>From what I read while ppl waited for it to get up that there were TONS of
> >>ppl in the chat room, many cussing and screaming about it. I've also
> >>noticed this when a few or all servers go down, ppl act like that can't
> >>wait
> >>for a few hours to get back on. Theres some much to real life and tons of
> >>things to do outside but yet ppl would rather sit in the house all day
> >>playing EQ instade of spending time with friends and loved ones but of
> >>course they just sit there and whin every 5 seconds about "When's it gonna
> >>be back up?" throw in a few cuss words and whin some more. I may be
> >>flamed
> >>for this letter, but I just can't see why ppl acted that way. Yes I play
> >>EQ
> >>like crazy, but I try to hang around friends and family as much as I can.
> >>Guess like that post on a web site said "I refuse to call EQ a real game,
> >>it's video game crack". If ya feel the need to flame me, go a head, but I
> >>bet many of you agree with what I'm saying here. It's just my 2 cents (or
> >>2cp).
> >>
> >>**************************
> >>Azor
> >>Lvl 18 Human Cleric of the Rathe
